Abstract: This review provides an update on adult transgender medicine, focusing on advancements since the Endocrine Society's 2017 treatment guidelines. It examines the latest research on gender-affirming hormone treatments for transfeminine and transmasculine individuals, highlighting efficacy, safety, and long-term outcomes. The review also addresses emerging trends in personalized medicine, including the impact of genetic and metabolic factors on treatment response. Additionally, it discusses the integration of mental health support in transgender care, emphasizing the importance of a multidisciplinary approach. By synthesizing recent findings, this update aims to inform healthcare providers about best practices and improve the quality of care for transgender patients, ultimately enhancing their overall well-being and quality of life.
